column4: if one have draged "stiffness" on wobbly windows up to max, so that any active windows jumps around like crazy.. what would be solution be?
a friend did it.
what do you mean?
well I changed an advanced setting on the wobbly windows so that the window is just jumping around like crazy, totally deformed. And I like to fix it :)
will it let you change at the same place?
I can't change anything now since any active window starts jumping around like crazy =>
I see
that's in gnome?
KDE actually
not sure for kde, but gnome you could use the gconf-editor from command line
thanks, I googled for gconf-editor for kde and found that it's "kwriteconfig".
there you go :)
I figured it must have something similar
it's kind of funny they'd allow such a crazy setting
you would think they would put an upper sane limit
maybe on that setting it will stop jumping around in a day or two
mount with loop option
but there's gotta be some nice gui tool for this.
I think nautilus will
seems like nautilus will do it transparently if you have dbus/hal installed
